title: What are some famous songs written in a minor key? - Quora

response.answer_text: During the Great Depression of the 1930s, popular songs in a minor key, although still relatively rare, became more common (e.g., My Funny Valentine, Brother Can You Spare a Dime, Let’s Face the Music and Dance, Puttin’ on the Ritz). Other songs that come to mind: I Love Paris, I Didn’t Know What Time it Was, St. James Infirmary, Big Spender. In some of their later songs, The Beatles also developed an attraction to minor keys: Eleanor Rigby, Fixing a Hole, While My Guitar Gently Weeps, Being for the Benefit of Mr. Kite. (“Help” starts with a minor chord; and the use of a minor scale with raised fourth degrees lends the intro [verse] of “Girl” an unexpectedly klezmer-esque quality.) Note, however, that many of the above songs inevitably shift to the major mode at some point; ending a piece in a minor key was still a highly unusual move in classic-era popular music.

A2A We tend to think of songs written in minor keys as sounding funereal or gloomy, but this isn't always the case. There are a surprising number of popular songs that are in a minor key. Off the top of my head I came up with the following: By The Beatles • “Eleanor Rigby” • “Come Together” • “I Want You” • “Because” • “Hotel California” by The Eagles • “Heart of Gold” by Neil Young • “A Horse with no Name” by America • “Along the Watchtower” by Bob Dylan • “Paint it Black” by The Rolling Stones • “Wonderwall” by Oasis
